result.execSummary:
The defendant Colin T Alexander Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample; pay surcharge. Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's. Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.

- No firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

- Successfully complete "Batterers Intervention" counseling.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED pending a review on 01-22-16

**01-22-16/ Judge Janet Protasiewicz**
Defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 20 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time, in the HOC

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Colin T Alexander Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Signed, Filed, and Distributed; Petition and Order Granting Funeral Pass.
Reflects 01-22-16 Court order imposing 20 days of condition time

Defendant Colin T Alexander not in court.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 20 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $240.00 entered as ordered by the court on 10/15/15 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 02/01/16. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs signed and filed on 10/15/15.  Copy sent to defendant.   rmm

AS TO THE AMENDED CHARGE:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  
.
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 1/22/16.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-DNA sample; pay the surcharge.  Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Colin T Alexander in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 968.075(1)(a), a Class B Misdemeanor.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Colin T Alexander in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered case adjourned in branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for 08-24-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Leah R. Thomas in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel informs Court that she has been in contact with defendant; she is requesting a change to the adjourn date.
Case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 40.  Defense counsel will notify defendant of the next court date.
Clerk:  jms

ADDRESS INFO for Colin T Alexander Jr
Current: 2200 West Kilbourn #512, Milwaukee, WI   (Effective: 08-05-2015)
Prior: 2200 West Kilbourn #512, Milwaukee, WI
Atty. L. Thomas contacted the court and accepted the appointment.
Status conference scheduled for 09-03-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Colin T Alexander in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Statements by the Defendant.  Based upon review of the Defendant's statements made in court, the Court finds that the Defendant is indigent and does qualify for representation at the County's expense. Court will appoint counsel for Defendant.  The Court appoints Attorney Leah Thomas to represent defendant at the rate of $60 per hour;  Attorney Thomas NOT present in court but will be contacted by the deputy clerk as to the appointment. 

Court ordered Defendant to contribute to legal expenses at a rate of  $50 per month, the first payment due on or before October 1, 2015.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  All payments should be made directly to the Clerk of Courts Office.  Court ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel in Branch 40.  Order Appointing Counsel signed by the Court and filed.  Copies to be mailed to the parties.

Defendant is advised by the Court that all conditions of bail remain as previously set including the No Contact Order.
Clerk:  jms

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07/17/2015
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Samantha W.

Defendant Colin T Alexander in court.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 40.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7/20/15 @ 1:30 pm
